verses.plain: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,

tokens.t: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy
brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,

verses.plain: And to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:

tokens.t: And to
beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:

verses.plain: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

tokens.t: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.plain: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,

tokens.t: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,

verses.plain: Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;

tokens.t: Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;

verses.plain: That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.

tokens.t: That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.

verses.plain: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.

tokens.t: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.

verses.plain: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,

tokens.t: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,

verses.plain: Yet for love’s sake I rather beseech thee, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

tokens.t: Yet for love’s sake I rather beseech
, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

verses.plain: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:

tokens.t: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:

verses.plain: Which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:

tokens.t: Which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:

verses.plain: Whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:

tokens.t: Whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:

verses.plain: Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:

tokens.t: Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:

verses.plain: But without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.

tokens.t: But without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.

verses.plain: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;

tokens.t: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;

verses.plain: Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?

tokens.t: Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?

verses.plain: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.

tokens.t: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.

verses.plain: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine account;

tokens.t: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth
ought, put that on mine account;

verses.plain: I Paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.

tokens.t: I Paul have written
with mine own hand, I will repay
: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.

verses.plain: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.

tokens.t: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.

verses.plain: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.

tokens.t: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.

verses.plain: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.

tokens.t: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.

verses.plain: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;

tokens.t: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;

verses.plain: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.

tokens.t: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.

verses.plain: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.

tokens.t: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ
with your spirit. Amen.
